Los Pintores Argentinos en LRA Radio Nacional (1959) was a touring art exhibition organized by LRA Radio Nacional, the Argentine national radio station. This event took place in the context of a national effort that was set in motion after the overthrow of Juan Perón to renovate and modernize Argentine art. It was one of the many initiatives emerging from both the public and private sectors "to promote an identity for Argentine art, to situate it in the world, and to secure its long-anticipated recognition" after a decade-long period of isolation from the world scene resulting from Perón's nationalist policiesRomero Brest, Jorge (1956). Palabras liminares. XXVIII Exposición Bienal Internacional de Arte de Venecia, Exhibition catalogue. pp. 7–8. The premise of this show was to showcase a collection of thirty modern-figurative paintings by notable artists such as Antonio Berni, Raul Soldi, Juan del Prete, Carlos Alonso, Norah Borges that had been featured in the cover of the radio station's program magazine between 1957 and 1959.
